meanings.definition: The quality or state of being monotonous.
meanings.sent1: The monotonousness of the lecture made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent2: The monotonousness of the daily routine was starting to wear on her.
meanings.sent3: The monotonousness of the clock ticking became oddly comforting.
meanings.sent4: The monotonousness of the rain tapping on the roof echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The monotonousness of the humming fan filled the room with a dull drone.

meanings.definition: Lack of variety and interest; tedious repetition.
meanings.sent1: The monotonousness of the music playlist made her switch it off.
meanings.sent2: His speech was filled with the monotonousness of cliches and empty phrases.
meanings.sent3: The monotonousness of the traffic jam was broken by a sudden burst of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The monotonousness of the desert landscape stretched endlessly in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The monotonousness of the ticking clock seemed to slow down time itself.
